snippet: A constitutional amendment or a careful system of regulation can diminish the flow of unlimited third-party spending.
abstract: Editorial contends that campaign finance reform is the most urgent challenge facing every lawmaker in the nation, no matter what the results of the 2012 election turn out to be; warns that unlimited spending by so-called independent groups is so corrupting that, win or lose, it binds lawmakers, corporations and special interests ever closer.
lead_paragraph: A constitutional amendment or a careful system of regulation can diminish the flow of unlimited third-party spending.

headline.seo: The Cacophony of Money in Political Advertisements
